description.en: Information such as email, telephone that allows the person to be contacted.

rawTags.definition-en: Information such as email, telephone that allows the person to be contacted.

description.en: Legal connection of a person with a state, which carries certain rights and obligations.

usage.en: In Belgium, this matter is organized in the Belgian Nationality Code. We use the term citizenship instead of nationality to align with international practice (e.g., terminology used in SEMIC Core Person). For the purposes of this data model, the term citizenship translates to "nationaliteit" in Dutch en "nationalité" in French.

rawTags.usageNote-en: In Belgium, this matter is organized in the Belgian Nationality Code. We use the term citizenship instead of nationality to align with international practice (e.g., terminology used in SEMIC Core Person). For the purposes of this data model, the term citizenship translates to "nationaliteit" in Dutch en "nationalité" in French.
rawTags.definition-en: Legal connection of a person with a state, which carries certain rights and obligations.

description.en: Place where a person lives or stays permanently or temporarily.

rawTags.definition-en: Place where a person lives or stays permanently or temporarily.

description.en: Address of the place of residence.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Plaats waar een persoon al dan niet tijdelijk woont of logeert.
rawTags.definition-en: Address of the place of residence.

description.en: Base from which a country conducts its diplomatic and consular activities in a foreign country.

rawTags.definition-en: Base from which a country conducts its diplomatic and consular activities in a foreign country.

description.en: The person being born.

rawTags.definition-en: The person being born.

description.en: The place of birth of the person.

rawTags.definition-en: The place of birth of the person.

description.en: The date on which the person was born.

rawTags.definition-en: The date on which the person was born.

description.en: Status of a person according to civil law.

usage.en: Refers to marriage, civil partnership, descent, guardianship, etc. It is, in other words, the condition of specific relationships between individuals.

rawTags.definition-en: Status of a person according to civil law.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Refers to marriage, civil partnership, descent, guardianship, etc. It is, in other words, the condition of specific relationships between individuals.

description.en: Value of civil status.

rawTags.definition-en: Value of civil status.

description.en: Death of a person.

rawTags.definition-en: Death of a person.

description.en: The location where the person passed away.

rawTags.definition-en: The location where the person passed away.

description.en: The date on which the person deceased.

rawTags.definition-en: The date on which the person deceased.

description.en: Descent is the descending line of blood relationship between different generations.

usage.en: The descent can be biological as well as non-biological, eg adoption. Descent can also be viewed in the ascending line. The concept is narrower than kinship that also includes marriage. There must be a direct link between the persons (no link between child and grandparent).

rawTags.definition-en: Descent is the descending line of blood relationship between different generations.
rawTags.usageNote-en: The descent can be biological as well as non-biological, eg adoption. Descent can also be viewed in the ascending line. The concept is narrower than kinship that also includes marriage. There must be a direct link between the persons (no link between child and grandparent).

description.en: Type of descent.

rawTags.definition-en: Type of descent.

description.en: Legal designation granted to natural persons, including diplomats and personnel of international organizations, who represent their home country or organization in a foreign country.

rawTags.definition-en: Legal designation granted to natural persons, including diplomats and personnel of international organizations, who represent their home country or organization in a foreign country.

description.en: Place within the jurisdiction of the registry where a person lives or stays, either permanently or temporarily.

rawTags.definition-en: Place within the jurisdiction of the registry where a person lives or stays, either permanently or temporarily.

description.en: European Union citizenship is afforded to all nationals of member states of the European Union (EU).

rawTags.definition-en: European Union citizenship is afforded to all nationals of member states of the European Union (EU).

description.en: Place outside the jurisdiction of the registry where a person lives or stays, either permanently or temporarily.

rawTags.definition-en: Place outside the jurisdiction of the registry where a person lives or stays, either permanently or temporarily.

description.en: Situation where a person acting as guardian is mandated to act on behalf of another person and in that capacity is responsible for this person and his goods.

usage.en: This is the case, for example, for minors who have lost their parents or for adults who have lost their intellectual faculties.

rawTags.definition-en: Situation where a person acting as guardian is mandated to act on behalf of another person and in that capacity is responsible for this person and his goods.
rawTags.usageNote-en: This is the case, for example, for minors who have lost their parents or for adults who have lost their intellectual faculties.

description.en: Form of cooperation that forms a recognizable social unit (eg through marriage), with persons who are blood relatives or not, who have lasting ties and provide mutual support and care.

usage.en: It is a broader concept than family where the family consists not solely of close relatives, eg a single-person family or living separately together. Household members usually share the same residence.

rawTags.definition-en: Form of cooperation that forms a recognizable social unit (eg through marriage), with persons who are blood relatives or not, who have lasting ties and provide mutual support and care.
rawTags.usageNote-en: It is a broader concept than family where the family consists not solely of close relatives, eg a single-person family or living separately together. Household members usually share the same residence.

description.en: Address of the residence of the household.

usage.en: Often used as a criterion to determine whether persons are part of the same household.

rawTags.definition-en: Address of the residence of the household.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Often used as a criterion to determine whether persons are part of the same household.

description.en: Role of the person within the household.

rawTags.definition-en: Role of the person within the household.

description.en: Legal designation granted under international law providing specific rights and obligations to natural persons who qualify.

rawTags.definition-en: Legal designation granted under international law providing specific rights and obligations to natural persons who qualify.

description.en: A form of cohabitation of two persons, organized by civil or religious law.

usage.en: Can, just like living together, form the basis of a household.

rawTags.definition-en: A form of cohabitation of two persons, organized by civil or religious law.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Can, just like living together, form the basis of a household.

description.en: Relation between two or more natural persons.

usage.en: Typically, these are civil law relationships (see civil status) but not necessarily limited thereto.

rawTags.definition-en: Relation between two or more natural persons.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Typically, these are civil law relationships (see civil status) but not necessarily limited thereto.

description.en: Role of the person in the relation.

usage.en: The role is expressed from the source to the target person. For example, Homer (source) has the role father with respect to Lisa (target).

rawTags.definition-en: Role of the person in the relation.
rawTags.usageNote-en: The role is expressed from the source to the target person. For example, Homer (source) has the role father with respect to Lisa (target).

description.en: Refers to the legal relationship that exist between a legal subject and a country or official body.

rawTags.definition-en: Refers to the legal relationship that exist between a legal subject and a country or official body.

description.en: Person whose details are officially listed in a register.

usage.en: This register is usually a population register, but it can also be an electoral register, for example. The registered data relates to the identity (e.g. family and given name) and the place of residence of the person and to important life events such as birth, marriage, decease, etc. These data are typically registered by the government, they offer the registered person legal protection and they allow the government to compile basic statistics about its population.

rawTags.definition-en: Person whose details are officially listed in a register.
rawTags.usageNote-en: This register is usually a population register, but it can also be an electoral register, for example. The registered data relates to the identity (e.g. family and given name) and the place of residence of the person and to important life events such as birth, marriage, decease, etc. These data are typically registered by the government, they offer the registered person legal protection and they allow the government to compile basic statistics about its population.

description.en: Describes the situation where an individual resides or maintains a residence in a specific jurisdiction, without necessarily implying any legal status or entitlements associated with that presence.

rawTags.definition-en: Describes the situation where an individual resides or maintains a residence in a specific jurisdiction, without necessarily implying any legal status or entitlements associated with that presence.

description.en: Arrangement whereby two people who are not married live together.

usage.en: Can, just like a marriage, form the basis of a household.

rawTags.definition-en: Arrangement whereby two people who are not married live together.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Can, just like a marriage, form the basis of a household.

description.en: A natural person.

usage.en: In legal terms, it concerns a person (in the legal sense, ie with its own legal personality) of the human species, ie a natural person. The counterpart is the legal person, a legal construction that gives a private or public organization the same legal personality as a natural person (eg can also have debts, conclude contracts, be sued, etc.).

rawTags.definition-en: A natural person.
rawTags.usageNote-en: In legal terms, it concerns a person (in the legal sense, ie with its own legal personality) of the human species, ie a natural person. The counterpart is the legal person, a legal construction that gives a private or public organization the same legal personality as a natural person (eg can also have debts, conclude contracts, be sued, etc.).

description.en: The complete name of the person as one string.

rawTags.definition-en: The complete name of the person as one string.

description.en: Name given to a child at birth. Distinguishes the child from the other children in the family.

rawTags.definition-en: Name given to a child at birth. Distinguishes the child from the other children in the family.

description.en: Part of person's full name received from the previous generation.

usage.en: Called family name because it indicates a familial relationship.

rawTags.definition-en: Part of person's full name received from the previous generation.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Called family name because it indicates a familial relationship.

description.en: Name based on the given name of the person's father.

rawTags.definition-en: Name based on the given name of the person's father.

description.en: Given name that an individual chooses to be called and recognized by.

rawTags.definition-en: Given name that an individual chooses to be called and recognized by.

description.en: Used to refer to a woman's family name at birth, distinguishing it from any family name she may take after marriage.

rawTags.definition-en: Used to refer to a woman's family name at birth, distinguishing it from any family name she may take after marriage.

description.en: Refers to the death details of the person.

rawTags.definition-en: Refers to the death details of the person.

description.en: Refers to the birth details of the person.

rawTags.definition-en: Refers to the birth details of the person.

description.en: Honorary distinction of the person.

description.en: Name based on the given name of the person's mother.

description.en: The administrative gender of the person.

description.en: Reference to the communication means through which the person can be contacted.
